conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the given velocity-time graph to determine the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval.
Identify the relevant time interval on the velocity-time graph. The interval of interest is from 10 seconds to 15 seconds.
Determine the velocity at the start and end of the interval. At 10 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s. At 15 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.

premise: Velocity at 10 seconds is 20 m/s and at 15 seconds is 10 m/s.
conclusion: Calculate the distance fallen using the formula for distance: Distance = Initial velocity × Time. Distance = 20 m/s × 5 s = 100 m.
Since the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is 100 meters, it is greater than 75 meters.

conclusion: Conclude that the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than 75 meters.
